Questions.Question: Who said, 'No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted'?
Questions.Explanation: Aesop, the ancient Greek storyteller, is credited with this saying, emphasizing the value of even the smallest acts of kindness.

Questions.Question: Which famous figure expressed, 'Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible'?
Questions.Explanation: The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, is the spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism and promotes the message of kindness in every situation.

Questions.Question: Who is associated with the quote, 'Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see'?
Questions.Explanation: Renowned author Mark Twain, known for his wit and wisdom, penned this quote emphasizing the universal nature of kindness.

Questions.Explanation: Scott Adams, the creator of the 'Dilbert' comic strip, is credited with this empowering quote about the pervasive impact of kindness.

Questions.Question: Who expressed, 'We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give'?
Questions.Explanation: Sir Winston Churchill, British Prime Minister, highlighted the importance of giving and kindness in shaping a meaningful life.
